page.title: 08Pontefract Open Cast Mine(1)
page.content: The mine was started in 1983. It belongs to the N.C.B. but Faircloughs do the work. It is a gigantic hole covering 130 acres and is 140' deep. There are three seams of coal, the thickest is 1 metre. The coal is obtained by first removing the soil and rocks. This is done by machines like power shovels or scrapers. One machine's bucket scooped up 24 tons of rock in one go. If rocks are hard, explosives are used to loosen them. A coal remover is a drag-line which has a bucket hung from a long arm. The drag-line pulls the bucket and picks up the coal, lorries take the coal to disposal points to mix with other coal. 800 tons of coal are mined each day. 71 men are employed, and will be for 3 years.
